text: Not sure if this is the right channel for this. Is it possible to have one landing page reside on a different domain? Lets say my current site exists on <http://example.com|example.com>, but I have one landing page in my site that I want to exist on <http://cool-example.com|cool-example.com>. Does HubSpot allow that? I've tried searching and come up with nothing so far.
Hi! HubSpot Marketing Enterprise with the addon Brand Domain might the thing you’re looking for?
yeah we are on marketing professional right now

:boom: From my understanding you need the enterprise solution and also a brand domain. Pricy stuff as crazy, but that should do the work? But when u say subdomain - youre referring to a HubSpot landing page hosted on a subdomain? like <http://coolwhitepaper.cool-example.com|coolwhitepaper.cool-example.com> ?

Or <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/can-i-host-my-HubSpot-content-on-multiple-subdomains>:

```Marketing Hub Enterprise accounts can host content on unlimited subdomains for the same brand domain. You'll set one subdomain as primary for each content tool (Blog, Landing Pages, Email) in your domain manager. To publish content on a different subdomain, use the alternative domain dropdown from the Settings tab of the content editor.```
no, i don't want a subdomain. i need it to basically look like it is residing on <http://www.cool-example.com|www.cool-example.com>
aha, so you´re building the whole website in the HubSpot cms?
It's literally just a landing page, but they want it to look like it resides on its own domain. I don't know why it can't just redirect, but that's the decision they've decided upon.
what cms is the website built with?
i want it to reside in HubSpots portal, but display as if it's coming from a different domain than my primary domain.
i could easily host this on another server, but i don't really want to do that if i have the option through HubSpot because it's already built out.

Hmm okay now im not the right person to answer anymore as i misunderstood the parameters :wink: But it sounds like a brand domain-thing after all. If thats the case: a veeery expensive way to get what they want, if thats the only thing :stuck_out_tongue:
